response_dict_list.question: What makes Sam Altman a good founder?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: He has a great force of will.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Sam Altman is considered a good founder because he possesses qualities and characteristics that make him successful in the startup world.
retrieved_context: Honestly, Sam is, along with Steve Jobs, the founder I refer to most when I'm advising startups.

response_dict_list.question: When was the essay "Five Founders" written?
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The essay "Five Founders" was written in April 2009.
retrieved_context:
Learning from Founders

January 2007

(Foreword to Jessica Livingston's Founders at Work.

Five Founders

April 2009

Inc recently asked me who I thought were the 5 most interesting startup founders of the last 30 years.

response_dict_list.question: When does the most dramatic growth happen for a startup?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: When the startup only has three or four people.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The most dramatic growth for a startup typically occurs when it only has three or four people.
retrieved_context: The really dramatic growth happens when a startup only has three or four people,
It's that way with most startups too.The earliest phase is usually the most productive.That's when they have the really big ideas.

response_dict_list.question: What is the problem with business culture versus start up culture with respect to productivity?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: In business culture, energy is expended on outward appearance to the detriment of productivity, while in startup culture there is no value of appearance it's all about productivity.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The problem with business culture versus start-up culture with respect to productivity is that big companies often lack the same level of productivity as start-ups. Start-ups are able to achieve a higher level of productivity in their first year, which is not typically seen in big companies.
retrieved_context: )Ditto for most of the other differences between startups and what passes for productivity in big companies.
only a handful people got to see: what happens in the first year of a startup.This is what real productivity looks like.

response_dict_list.question: What's the single biggest thing the government could do to increase the number of startups in this country?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Establish a new class of visa for startup founders.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: The government could potentially increase the number of startups by implementing policies and initiatives that support and encourage entrepreneurship. This could include providing tax incentives or grants for startups, creating a favorable regulatory environment, and offering resources and support for aspiring entrepreneurs. By fostering an ecosystem that is conducive to startup growth, the government can attract and nurture innovative businesses.
retrieved_context: thing the government could do to increase the number of startups
and use investment by recognized startup investors as the test of whether a company was a real startup.How would the government decide who's a startup investor?

response_dict_list.question: How could one create a rigorous government definition of what a startup is to categorize whether a business is a startup?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: One could define a startup as a company that has received investment by recognized startup investors. An accreditation procedure would be determined to establish recognized startup investors.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: One possible approach to creating a rigorous government definition of what a startup is to categorize whether a business is a startup could be to rely on the market to determine this. By looking at the investment made by recognized startup investors, the government could use this as a test to determine whether a company qualifies as a startup. This approach allows the government to leverage the expertise and judgment of experienced investors in the startup ecosystem to make this determination.
retrieved_context: and use investment by recognized startup investors as the test of whether a company was a real startup.How would the government decide who's a startup investor?
The tricky part might seem to be how one defined a startup.But that could be solved quite easily: let the market decide.

response_dict_list.question: Why is frienship a good quality of founders?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Friendship is a good quality of founders because building a startup is tough and without a strong friendship building the startup will tear the founders apart.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Friendship is a good quality of founders because it helps to establish a strong and positive working relationship between them. When founders genuinely like one another and have a strong friendship, they are more likely to communicate effectively, trust each other, and collaborate well. This can contribute to a harmonious and productive work environment, which is crucial for the success of a startup. Additionally, friendship can also help founders navigate through the challenges and uncertainties that come with starting a business, as they can provide emotional support and encouragement to each other.
retrieved_context: FriendshipEmpirically it seems to be hard to start a startup with just one founder.Most of the big successes have two or three.
And the relationship between the founders has to be strong.They must genuinely like one another, and work well together.

response_dict_list.question: Why is determination the most important quality in startup founders?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: Because when building a startup you're going to hit a lot of obstacles, and determination will prevent one from getting demoralized by the constant obstacles.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Determination is considered the most important quality in startup founders because it surpasses the significance of intelligence. While a certain level of intelligence is necessary, determination is what truly matters.
retrieved_context: DeterminationThis has turned out to be the most important quality in startup founders.
And certainly you don't want founders to be stupid.But as long as you're over a certain threshold of intelligence, what matters most is determination.

response_dict_list.question: For startups, what does board control mean in practice?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: During board meetings, matters are decided in the discussion preceding the vote, not in the vote itself, which is usually unanimous. If opinion is divided in such discussions, the side that knows it would lose in a vote tends to be less insistent. This is what board control means in practice.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: Board control in practice for startups refers to the ability of the founders to maintain control over the decision-making process and strategic direction of the company even after securing a series A funding round. This means that the founders have the power to make key decisions and shape the overall direction of the startup, potentially influencing the company's culture and operations.
retrieved_context: That's what board control means in practice.
Which means if it becomes the norm for founders to retain board control after a series A, that will change the way things feel in the whole startup world.

response_dict_list.question: What's in the way of founders keeping board control after a series A?
response_dict_list.reference_answer: The perception that founders keeping board control after a series A being a concession a VC has made when negotiating with startups. VCs do not want to look like they've lost a negotiation. If founders keeping control after a series A is the norm, then it happening will not look like the VCs lost the negotiation.
response_dict_list.llm_answer: VCs are often resistant to founders retaining board control after a series A.
retrieved_context: A lot of VCs still act as if founders retaining board control after a series A is unheard-of.
In the past, founders rarely kept control of the board through a series A.
